subject: Psychology
title: Self-Fulfilling Prophecy
description: A quick win: understand Self-Fulfilling Prophecy.

hook.text: A teacher expects a student to fail. She gives less attention. The student fails. The prophecy fulfilled itself.

buildup.text: A self-fulfilling prophecy occurs when a false belief triggers behavior that makes the belief come true.

discovery.text: Rosenthal's study told teachers random students were 'bloomers.' Those students actually improved more by year's end.

twist.text: The students didn't change. The teachers' expectations changed their behavior â€” more warmth, patience, and feedback.

climax.text: Beliefs about people shape how we treat them, which shapes who they become. Expectation is a powerful force.

punchline.text: What you expect from someone often becomes what you get.

quiz.question: What did Rosenthal's study demonstrate?
options: Students are unaffected by teacher behavior
